content:
I'd be happy to help you with some upbeat song suggestions for your Zumba classes!

Here are some high-energy tracks that might get your students moving and grooving:

1. **Latin-inspired tracks**:
	* "Havana" by Camila Cabello ft. Young Thug
	* "Mi Gente" by J Balvin & Willy William
	* "Vaina Loca" by Ozuna
	* "Ay Vamos" by J Balvin
2. **Upbeat pop and rock anthems**:
	* "Can't Stop the Feeling!" by Justin Timberlake
	* "Happy" by Pharrell Williams
	* "Uptown Funk" by Mark Ronson ft. Bruno Mars
	* "We Will Rock You" by Queen
3. **Dance-oriented hits**:
	* "I Like to Move It" by Reel 2 Real ft. The Mad Stuntman
	* "Pumped Up Kicks" by Foster the People
	* "Shut Up and Dance" by Walk the Moon
	* "Cake by the Ocean" by DNCE
4. **Hip-hop and R&B bangers**:
	* "Old Town Road" by Lil Nas X ft. Billy Ray Cyrus
	* "Senorita" by Shawn Mendes and Camila Cabello
	* "Finesse" (Remix) by Bruno Mars and Cardi B
	* "Bodak Yellow" by Cardi B

These songs should give you a great starting point for creating an energetic and fun playlist for your Zumba classes! You can also consider including some classic Zumba tracks, like "Waka Waka" by Shakira or "La Gozadera" by Gente de Zona ft. Marc Anthony.

Remember to choose songs that fit your teaching style and the vibe you want to create in your classes. You can also experiment with different genres and tempos to keep your students engaged and motivated throughout the workout!

Hope this helps, and have fun creating your new playlist!
